original_title: China to boost investment opportunities in Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: CZK Huarui International Economy and Trade Development (Beijing) Co. Ltd., Chairman and CZK International Resources Investment Corporation Vice Chairman Liu Yafei, visited Sri Lanka last week with 12 delegates, all belonging to various industries with investment potential in Sri Lanka. During their brief stay in the country, they conducted extensive meetings with President’s Chief of Staff Sagala Ratnayaka, Tourism Minister Harin Fernando and other Sri Lanka Tourism officials, State Minister of Small and Medium Enterprises Prasanna Ranaweera, Board of Investment Chairman and officials, Export Development Board Chairman and officials in an effort to view/assess potential investment opportunities in Sri Lanka.

The visit was endorsed and initiated by Sri Lanka’s Ambassador in China Palitha Kohona, and all ground arrangements were organised by leading destination management company Connaissance De Ceylan Ltd.
